subject: Photography
title: Analogous Color Schemes
description: A fast breakdown of Analogous Color Schemes for builders.

hook.text: Yellow, orange, and red. Blue, teal, and green. Neighbors on the color wheel create effortless harmony.

buildup.text: Analogous colors are three to five hues sitting next to each other on the wheel. They share underlying tones.

discovery.text: Nature uses analogous palettes everywhere â€” autumn leaves, ocean gradients, flower gardens.

twist.text: Analogous schemes are harmonious but can feel monotonous. A small accent from across the wheel adds interest.

climax.text: Photographers use analogous colors to create calm, unified images that feel cohesive and immersive.

quiz.question: What characterizes an analogous color scheme?
options: Three to five neighboring hues on the color wheel
Colors from opposite sides of the wheel
